snippet: The City Council speaker Christine C. Quinn said name-calling was “not appropriate” in a democracy, demanded an apology, and left when no one stepped forward.
abstract: New York City Council speaker Christine Quinn walks out of a rally after a participant derided city’s mayor as 'Pharaoh Bloomberg;' says she will not tolerate name-calling in political debates; action, in front of supporters of so-called living wage measure, has potential to become a symbolic moment in her campaign for mayor, viewed as either a principled stand that makes her appear mayoral or a fit of pique that could prove a liability.
lead_paragraph: The City Council speaker Christine C. Quinn said name-calling was “not appropriate” in a democracy, demanded an apology, and left when no one stepped forward.

headline.seo: Quinn Quits Living-Wage Rally After Bloomberg Is Insulted
headline.main: Quinn Quits Wage Rally After Bloomberg Is Insulted
headline.print_headline: Quinn Quits Rally After Mayor Is Insulted
